title: Debug & Analysis MCP Toolsets
body:
Purpose: Provide a stable, enterprise-safe grouping of configured MCP tools for troubleshooting, code analysis, PowerShell diagnostics, and CI/CD investigation.

Source Servers (already configured & trusted):
- Azure MCP Server: monitor, kusto, azureActivityLog
- Datadog MCP: datadog
- PowerShell MCP Server: powershell-syntax-check, run-powershell, server-stats, working-directory-policy
- Azure DevOps MCP: build_get_log, build_get_status
- GitHub MCP: get_job_logs, get_workflow_run_logs

Toolsets:
1. azureDebugging
   - monitor, kusto, azureActivityLog, datadog
   - Focus: Platform & workload telemetry (logs, queries, performance)
2. codeAnalysis
   - codebase, search, usages, problems
   - Focus: Code navigation, static indicators, reference tracing
3. powerShellDiagnostics
   - powershell-syntax-check, run-powershell, server-stats, working-directory-policy
   - Focus: Script correctness, controlled execution, environment policy
4. devOpsIntelligence
   - build_get_log, build_get_status, get_job_logs, get_workflow_run_logs
   - Focus: Pipeline failures, workflow traceability, cross-system build triage

Selection Criteria:
- Safety: Only tools from currently registered servers (no speculative additions)
- Debugging relevance: Direct contribution to investigation loops (observe -> hypothesize -> validate)
- Complementarity: Each set forms a minimal self-contained diagnostic slice
- Uniform size: 4 tools per set for cognitive consistency & prompt economy
- Repo alignment: Supports PowerShell automation + Azure operations focus

Usage Guidance:
- Use set name when prompting for multi-step diagnosis (e.g., "Leverage devOpsIntelligence to gather failing workflow context")
- Combine azureDebugging + powerShellDiagnostics for runtime vs script cause isolation
- Start with codeAnalysis before deep runtime telemetry if failure reproduces locally

Versioning & Maintenance:
- Increment minor version (v1 -> v1.1) when swapping or adding a tool within an existing set
- Increment major version (v1 -> v2) if adding/removing an entire set or redefining selection criteria
- Defer expansion until a clear investigative gap recurs >= 3 times

Anti-Patterns to Avoid:
- Mixing write/destructive tools into these read-focused sets
- Expanding with overlapping synonyms (keeps signals crisp)
- Adding experimental servers before internal vetting

Future Extension Candidates (Not Included Yet):
- metrics_snapshot (observability meta)
- health_check / feature_status (infrastructure meta integrity)
- feedback_list (if adopting structured incident capture)

Prompt Hint Template:
"Using <toolsetName>, gather initial signals; summarize anomalies; propose next focused probe."
requirement: Provide reusable safe debugging tool grouping for consistent AI reasoning.
